intro: Lessingia adenophora, commonly known as the glandularless flowering plant, is a species of flowering plant in the family Brassicaceae. It is native to the western United States, particularly found in arid and semi-arid regions. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pale yellow flowers and hairy stems. It typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to harsh environmental conditions. Lessingia adenophora has small, pinnately lobed leaves that help reduce water loss in its dry habitat.
